summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, dated October 25, 2021. It details the production of additional witness materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio material, for potential trial witnesses, as well as materials for individuals not currently intended to be called. The letter clarifies document markings due to a protective order and notes the government's right to amend disclosures.

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act and Giglio materials, as well as witness statements, to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Previous Document Production
events.description: The government had previously produced a set of records (stamped 3501.450 through 3501.459) which are being reproduced with corrected stamps to avoid confusion.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling and dissemination of confidential materials.

keyFacts: The government is producing Jencks Act and Giglio materials for potential trial witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, as well as materials for individuals not currently intended to be called.
The production includes witness statements and is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, with specific confidentiality markings.
The government clarifies a prior production error where document stamps were inadvertently duplicated and is reproducing the materials to avoid confusion.
The letter explicitly states the government reserves the right to call individuals listed in the indices as witnesses at trial, even if not currently intended.
The document indicates that many individuals referenced in the production are represented by counsel, as detailed in the enclosed indices.
